derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from medieval Latin perceptivus, from percept- 'received, understood', from the verb percipere (see perceive)

entry.tran: 观察敏锐的；有洞察力的；有悟性的
entry.def: If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious.

example.ex: He was one of the most perceptive US political commentators.
example.tran: 他是美国最具洞察力的政治评论家之一。
对华兹华斯颇有见地的批评

means.word_mean: 2. having the ability to perceive or understand; keen in discernment;

auth_sentence.content: This was no compliment, but it was perceptive.

means.word_mean: 洞察力强的;敏锐的;理解力强的

sentences.en: a highly perceptive analysis of the problem
sentences.cn: 对问题深入透彻的分析

sentences.en: It’s no good trying to pull the wool over Harlod’s eyes,he’s far too perceptive.
sentences.cn: 无法蒙骗哈罗德,他洞察力太强了。
